page.title: 14HEALTH CARE IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
There are no medical facilities in the area, and most residents attend the doctors' surgery at Kimbolton for routine treatment. When necessary, the doctors visit patients in their own homes, and the services of a community nurse are also available. Dental care is obtained at nearby towns, usually Huntingdon or St. Neots.
The nearest hospital is also at Huntingdon, but patients are sometimes referred to hospitals at Cambridge or Bedford. A hospital car service can be arranged for those without private transport.
Special transport is also provided to take mentally and physically handicapped children and adults and elderly, housebound patients to day centres in the towns.
